Posts.Content: dlamb514 wrote: Well, I'm not sure yet.. had my new 'baseline' mammogram done more than a week ago .. they recommended me having an ultrasound since there was a 'questionable spot' in the same breast I had surgery/cancer in.  So, I got this done this past Thursday afternoon and still have yet to get any real results.  The gal who did my ultrasound has been at the hospital in that job for over 20 years and said it didn't look like a solid mass..  looked fluid.  Asked me if I have been having warmth & pain in that area which I have been..  and said it could possibly be an 'abscess'..  So, here I sit waiting for the doctor to READ my ultrasound and do a report.  I have to wait the weekend now since obviously the office is closed but yikes!  I had a very bad radiation experience on that breast only six months ago.. complete with lots of large open blistered areas, etc.  My scar area has a lot of hardness which I was told will happen after radiation.  The area in question is at the top part of my breast scar from surgery.   Has anyone ever had any problems with fluid collection near their scar after radiation or abscesses?  I really don't know 100% if that's what the case is with me but I am anxious now having to wait the weekend for answers.  I know things can move very slowly when you have had abnormal mammograms, etc, but I think stuff like this should be read as soon as possible..  I have had enough angst after a year's worth of first, surgery, then chemo and radiation..  It's so scary to have to wait for the results..  Thanks.  :o) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Found something on new baseline mammo dlamb514 LuAnnH
